ygData.subject: RE: NPCs selling lambent stones (was Lambent Stones on E'ci)
ygData.msgSnippet: Another reply to multiple messages. 1.	In this case I imagine it was a stone that someone sold to the vendor. It was not in the standard goods. 2.	How long
ygData.messageBody:
Another reply to multiple messages.

1. In this case I imagine it was a stone that someone sold to the vendor. It
was not in the standard goods.

2. How long will it be there? Until it is sold or there is a server reboot.
It will still be there after the vendor dies.

3. A vendor has many more inventory slots than what is shown. One of the
Tailoring guides floating around (Look on Allakazam's site) gives a long
description and example of searching for an item in a vendor's inventory.
(Mostly focuses on buying the vendor out of ruined pelts but it can be
adapted for Morti Staves and the like.

Good Journey

Sineras Silverlyre, The Divine Alliance (Cazic-Thule)

-----Original Message-----
From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
Sent: Thursday, December 09, 1999 2:49 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] NPCs selling lambent stones (was Lambent Stones on
E'ci)


From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>

Well I learned something new today. I was always under the impression that
lambent stones could only be acquired by killing a giant or griffon. Never
knew you could buy them from NPCs. Can someone list the known locations
where NPCs sell them?

Thanks
Galtin of E'ci


> Another thing. I was wanting a stone the other night for my last piece of
> Lambent. The zone was camped and I couldn't find ONE giant, much less
> two.
> I /auc'd for a stone and some jackass wanted 100pp. I said "Hey guy, I
> can
> buy one from the INN in Rathe Mts., a 60 second run, for 48pp." He called
> me a liar of course, so I ran to the Inn and bought it for 48pp.

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
